definition[0]: a female worker who is in charge of a group of other workers, especially in a factory
definition[1]: a woman who is the leader of a jury and announces their decision in court
definition[2]: a woman who is in charge of a group of workers, for example in a factory
example[0]: the forewoman at a watch factory
definition[3]: a woman who is the leader of a JURY (=the group of ordinary people who decide whether someone is guilty in some courts of law)
example[1]: The defendant stared expressionlessly as the forewoman of the six-man, six-woman jury announced the guilty verdict.
